intro: Boechera cascadensis, commonly known as the Cascade rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its basal rosette of elliptic to ovate leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. Boechera cascadensis is notable for its ability to tolerate cold climates and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
